list.title: Location Services
list.title_sub: Limit When and How Often Apps Access Your Location.

list.title: Avoid Maximizing Your Charge Cycles
list.title_sub: According to Apple, after roughly 500 charge cycles, iPhones retain only up to 80% of their original battery capacity.

list.title: Turn on Low Power Mode
list.title_sub: Low Power Mode has been around for a few years now, and it's the number one best setting to enable if you're concerned about battery life.

list.title: Limit Apps Using Bluetooth
list.title_sub: iOS 13, users gained a valuable feature that notifies them when apps request Bluetooth access

list.title: Use WiFi Whenever Possible
list.title_sub: WiFi uses less power than a cellular connection, so to maximize battery life

list.title: Manage Apps That Are Draining Battery
list.title_sub: Indeed, the iPhone provides users with the ability to monitor battery usage, allowing them to identify and address any apps that might be consuming excessive power.

list.title: Limit Background Activity
list.title_sub: Background app refreshing is a feature that allows apps to update and fetch new data even when they are not actively open on the screen.

list.title: Adjust Mail Fetch Settings
list.title_sub: Beyond disabling Background App Refresh, making adjustments to the frequency with which the Mail app checks for new emails can contribute to battery conservation on your iPhone.

list.title: Limit Notifications
list.title_sub: Reducing the number of notifications from apps is an effective method to conserve battery life on your device

list.title: Disable Automatic Downloads and App Updates
list.title_sub: To disable automatic downloads and app updates on your iPhone

list.title: Limit Use of Widgets
list.title_sub: Widgets on the Home Screen or in the Today View can contribute to battery drain.

list.title: Reset Your Apple Watch
list.title_sub: If you have an Apple Watch paired to your iPhone, it could be the cause of your battery drain problems.

list.title: Disable Vibrations and Haptic Feedback
list.title_sub: When your iPhone vibrates or provides haptic feedback to an interaction, Apple's Taptic Engine chip engages its physical motor.

list.title: Turn Off Fitness Tracking
list.title_sub: Motion coprocessor in the iPhone plays a crucial role in tracking and measuring various physical activities.

list.title: Disable Analytics
list.title_sub: If you're concerned about the impact on battery life due to sharing device analytics.

list.title: Erase Network Settings
list.title_sub: Resetting your iPhone's network settings can indeed be a potential solution to address battery drain issues.

list.title: Adjust Auto-Lock and Turn Off Raise to Wake
list.title_sub: Resetting your iPhone's network settings can indeed be a potential solution to address battery drain issues.
